paragraphs: Node.js is a runtime environment that allows you to run JavaScript on the server.
It is built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

It offers type checking and better tooling for large codebases.

paragraphs: CSS Grid and Flexbox are powerful layout systems.

articles.title: Machine Learning Basics
articles.subtitle: Getting started with machine learning in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
paragraphs: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that focuses on building systems that learn from data.
It is widely used in various applications such as recommendation systems, image recognition, and more.

blocks.code:
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

clf = RandomForestClassifier()
clf.fit(X_train, y_train)
predictions = clf.predict(X_test)

articles.title: Django for Web Development
articles.subtitle: Leveraging Django for rapid web development in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with Django
paragraphs: Django is a high-level Python web framework that enables rapid development of secure and maintainable websites.
It follows the 'batteries-included' philosophy, providing everything you need to build web applications out of the box.

articles.title: Understanding Docker
articles.subtitle: Docker for containerization and deployment in 2023

blocks.title: Docker Basics
paragraphs: Docker is a tool designed to make it easier to create, deploy, and run applications by using containers.
Containers allow developers to package an application with all of its parts and dependencies.

blocks.code:
docker build -t myapp .
docker run -p 4000:4000 myapp

articles.title: GraphQL Explained
articles.subtitle: Using GraphQL for efficient data fetching in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to GraphQL
paragraphs: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries by using a type system you define for your data.
It provides a more efficient, powerful, and flexible alternative to REST.

articles.title: Kubernetes for Orchestration
articles.subtitle: Managing containerized applications with Kubernetes in 2023

blocks.title: Kubernetes Basics
paragraphs: Kubernetes is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
It groups containers that make up an application into logical units for easy management and discovery.

blocks.code:
kubectl create deployment nginx --image=nginx
kubectl expose deployment nginx --port=80 --type=LoadBalancer

articles.title: Vue.js for Beginners
articles.subtitle: Getting started with Vue.js in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Vue.js
paragraphs: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.
It is designed to be incrementally adaptable and focuses on the view layer only.

articles.title: Go Programming Language
articles.subtitle: Why Go is great for modern software development in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Go
paragraphs: Go, also known as Golang, is a statically typed, compiled programming language designed for simplicity and efficiency.
It is particularly well-suited for building web servers and distributed systems.

articles.title: Ruby on Rails
articles.subtitle: Building web applications with Ruby on Rails in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with Ruby on Rails
paragraphs: Ruby on Rails, or Rails, is a server-side web application framework written in Ruby.
It follows the model-view-controller (MVC) architecture and emphasizes convention over configuration.

blocks.code:
rails new myapp
cd myapp
rails server

articles.title: Elixir for Concurrent Systems
articles.subtitle: Leveraging Elixir for scalable and maintainable applications in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Elixir
paragraphs: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language designed for building scalable and maintainable applications.
It runs on the Erlang VM, known for its ability to handle large numbers of concurrent connections.

blocks.code:
defmodule Hello do
    def world do
        IO.puts "Hello, World!"
    end
end

articles.title: Rust for System Programming
articles.subtitle: Why Rust is a great choice for system-level programming in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Rust
paragraphs: Rust is a systems programming language that provides memory safety without using garbage collection.
It is designed for performance and safety, particularly safe concurrency.

articles.title: Javascript news
articles.subtitle: Что нового в JS за 2022 год?

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Программа, которую по традиции называют «Hello, world!», очень проста. Она выводит куда-либо фразу «Hello, world!», или другую подобную, средствами некоего языка.

JavaScript — это язык, программы на котором можно выполнять в разных средах. В нашем случае речь идёт о браузерах и о серверной платформе Node.js. Если до сих пор вы не написали ни строчки кода на JS и читаете этот текст в браузере, на настольном компьютере, это значит, что вы буквально в считанных секундах от своей первой JavaScript-программы.

Существуют и другие способы запуска JS-кода в браузере. Так, если говорить об обычном использовании программ на JavaScript, они загружаются в браузер для обеспечения работы веб-страниц. Как правило, код оформляют в виде отдельных файлов с расширением .js, которые подключают к веб-страницам, но программный код можно включать и непосредственно в код страницы. Всё это делается с помощью тега <script>. Когда браузер обнаруживает такой код, он выполняет его. Подробности о теге script можно посмотреть на сайте w3school.com. В частности, рассмотрим пример, демонстрирующий работу с веб-страницей средствами JavaScript, приведённый на этом ресурсе. Этот пример можно запустить и средствами данного ресурса (ищите кнопку Try it Yourself), но мы поступим немного иначе. А именно, создадим в каком-нибудь текстовом редакторе (например — в VS Code или в Notepad++) новый файл, который назовём hello.html, и добавим в него следующий код:

blocks.code: ;

articles.title: Advanced JavaScript Patterns
articles.subtitle: Exploring design patterns in JavaScript for 2023

blocks.title: JavaScript Design Patterns
paragraphs: Design patterns are typical solutions to commonly occurring problems in software design.
They are like pre-made blueprints that you can customize to solve a recurring design problem in your code.

articles.title: Building REST APIs with Express
articles.subtitle: Create efficient RESTful APIs using Express.js in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with Express.js
paragraphs: Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features to develop web and mobile applications.
It facilitates the rapid development of Node-based web applications.

articles.title: Introduction to GraphQL
articles.subtitle: Learn the basics of GraphQL in 2023

blocks.title: What is GraphQL?
paragraphs: GraphQL is a query language for your API, and a server-side runtime for executing queries by using a type system you define for your data.
GraphQL isn't tied to any specific database or storage engine and is instead backed by your existing code and data.

articles.title: Developing with Angular
articles.subtitle: Modern web development with Angular in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Angular
paragraphs: Angular is a platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and TypeScript.
Angular is written in TypeScript and provides a standard structure for developers to work with.

articles.title: Building Mobile Apps with Flutter
articles.subtitle: Create beautiful mobile apps using Flutter in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with Flutter
paragraphs: Flutter is an open-source UI software development kit created by Google.
It is used to develop applications for Android, iOS, Linux, Mac, Windows, Google Fuchsia, and the web from a single codebase.

articles.title: Introduction to Rust
articles.subtitle: Why Rust is becoming a popular language in 2023

blocks.title: What is Rust?
paragraphs: Rust is a multi-paradigm, general-purpose programming language designed for performance and safety, especially safe concurrency.
Rust is syntactically similar to C++, but it provides memory safety without using garbage collection.

articles.title: Getting Started with Kotlin
articles.subtitle: Learn Kotlin for Android development in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Kotlin
paragraphs: Kotlin is a cross-platform, statically typed, general-purpose programming language with type inference.
It is designed to interoperate fully with Java, and the JVM version of Kotlin's standard library depends on the Java Class Library.

articles.title: Building Microservices with Spring Boot
articles.subtitle: Developing microservices using Spring Boot in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with Spring Boot
paragraphs: Spring Boot is an open-source Java-based framework used to create microservices.
It is developed by Pivotal Team and is used to build stand-alone and production-ready spring applications.

articles.title: Exploring Next.js
articles.subtitle: Server-side rendering with Next.js in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Next.js
paragraphs: Next.js is a React framework that enables several extra features, including server-side rendering and generating static websites.
It is built on top of Node.js and enables React-based web applications with server-side rendering capabilities.

articles.title: Introduction to Swift
articles.subtitle: Developing iOS apps with Swift in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with Swift
paragraphs: Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language for iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS.
Writing Swift code is interactive and fun, the syntax is concise yet expressive, and Swift includes modern features developers love.

articles.title: Using TensorFlow for Machine Learning
articles.subtitle: Implementing machine learning models with TensorFlow in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to TensorFlow
paragraphs: TensorFlow is an end-to-end open-source platform for machine learning.

It has a comprehensive, flexible ecosystem of tools, libraries, and community resources that lets researchers push the state-of-the-art in ML, and developers easily build and deploy ML-powered applications.

blocks.code:
import tensorflow as tf

# Create a constant tensor
hello = tf.constant('Hello, TensorFlow!')

# Start a TensorFlow session
with tf.Session() as sess:
  print(sess.run(hello))

articles.title: Introduction to PostgreSQL
articles.subtitle: Advanced database management with PostgreSQL in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with PostgreSQL
paragraphs: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system.
It has more than 15 years of active development and a proven architecture that has earned it a strong reputation for reliability, data integrity, and correctness.

articles.title: Introduction to Vue.js 3
articles.subtitle: New features and updates in Vue.js 3 for 2023

blocks.title: What's New in Vue.js 3?
paragraphs: Vue.js 3 is the latest version of the popular progressive framework for building user interfaces.
It introduces several new features and improvements, including a new composition API, improved performance, and better TypeScript support.

blocks.code:
import { createApp } from 'vue'
import App from './App.vue'

createApp(App).mount('#app')

articles.title: Serverless Applications with AWS Lambda
articles.subtitle: Building scalable applications with AWS Lambda in 2023

blocks.title: Getting Started with AWS Lambda
paragraphs: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.
You pay only for the compute time you consume - there is no charge when your code is not running.

articles.title: Introduction to WebAssembly
articles.subtitle: Enhancing web performance with WebAssembly in 2023

blocks.title: What is WebAssembly?
paragraphs: WebAssembly (Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine.
It is designed to be a portable compilation target for programming languages, enabling deployment on the web for client and server applications.

blocks.code:
(module
  (func $add (param $lhs i32) (param $rhs i32) (result i32)
    local.get $lhs
    local.get $rhs
    i32.add)
  (export "add" (func $add)))

articles.title: Getting Started with Clojure
articles.subtitle: Introduction to functional programming with Clojure in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Clojure
paragraphs: Clojure is a dynamic, general-purpose programming language, combining the approachability and interactive development of a scripting language with an efficient and robust infrastructure for multithreaded programming.
Clojure is a compiled language - it compiles directly to JVM bytecode, yet remains completely dynamic.

blocks.code:
(defn hello-world []
  (println "Hello, World!"))

articles.title: Getting Started with Svelte
articles.subtitle: Learn Svelte for building web applications in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Svelte
paragraphs: Svelte is a radical new approach to building user interfaces.
Whereas traditional frameworks like React and Vue do the bulk of their work in the browser, Svelte shifts that work into a compile step that happens when you build your app.

blocks.code: Hello {name}!

articles.subtitle: Why Julia is great for numerical computing in 2023

blocks.title: What is Julia?
paragraphs: Julia is a high-level, high-performance programming language for technical computing.
It is designed for computational science and numerical analysis.

blocks.code: println("Hello, Julia!")

articles.title: Functional Programming with Haskell
articles.subtitle: Explore functional programming paradigms with Haskell in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Haskell
paragraphs: Haskell is a purely functional programming language.
It is known for its rich type system and mathematical rigor.

blocks.code: main = putStrLn "Hello, Haskell!"

articles.title: Using Bash for Automation
articles.subtitle: Automate your tasks with Bash scripts in 2023

blocks.title: Introduction to Bash Scripting
paragraphs: Bash is a Unix shell and command language.
Writing scripts in Bash can automate a wide range of tasks.

blocks.code:
#!/bin/bash

echo "Hello, Bash!"
